DOC.brief_title: Home-Based Exercise Weight Control Program Pain Control Overweight Elderly With Osteoarthritis Knee
DOC.detailed_description: Osteoarthritis ( OA ) common chronic disease United States ( U.S. ) . Arthritis lead chronic illness among old adult U.S . Approximately 40 % individual 60 yr age OA knee . The primary objective propose study determine whether individual overweight OA knee complete 24-week home-based exercise program combine weight control intervention program report significantly less pain ( measure WOMAC ) volunteer participate home-based exercise ( Ex ) , weight control intervention ( WC ) , standard clinical care ( C ) . The secondary objective propose research determine whether overweight individual OA knee complete Ex+WC program , compare subject randomly assign E , WC C group , demonstrate significant improvement follow health risk profile variable : ( ) improve physical function ( measured Functional Performance Inventory ) , ( b ) improve capacity perform stair climb descending , ( c ) improve strength , ( ) increase lean body mass , ( e ) increase physical activity home ( measure pedometer step count ) . The proposed clinical trial utilize prospective , randomize two two factorial design . Descriptive ancova statistical method apply data analysis .
